content:
Diagnosis
	1. Squamous cell carcinoma of mid-esophagus T3N2M0

	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not performed

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Chemotherapy
	Completed 2 cycles of cisplatin/5FU

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease after 2 cycles chemotherapy

	Current issues
	Mild dysphagia to solids only

	Summary of consultation
	Case discussed at Upper GI MDT on 15 April 2024. [redacted name] is a 62-year-old gentleman with locally advanced esophageal SCC, p16 positive with PDL1 CPS 30. Initial staging showed T3N2M0 disease with multiple regional nodes but no distant metastases.

He has completed 2 cycles of induction cisplatin/5FU with stable disease on recent CT. Tolerated treatment well with only grade 1 nausea. Performance status remains 0.

MDT recommendation is to proceed with definitive chemoradiotherapy given good response to induction chemotherapy. Plan for 50Gy in 25 fractions with concurrent weekly carboplatin.

	Further investigations
	Repeat CT and planning scan next week

	Medication prescribed
	None

	Follow up
	To be seen in radiotherapy planning clinic next week

	Required GP actions
	None

cancer_timeline.value: Completed 2 cycles cisplatin/5FU with stable disease on CT

status_updates.value: Locally advanced esophageal SCC showing stable disease after induction chemotherapy. MDT recommends proceeding to definitive chemoradiotherapy.
Stable disease after 2 cycles of induction cisplatin/5FU
Plan for definitive chemoradiotherapy with 50Gy in 25 fractions and concurrent weekly carboplatin
Repeat CT and planning scan next week
To be seen in radiotherapy planning clinic next week
